description: Returns the cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) configuration information that is set for the container. To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the MediaStore:GetCorsPolicy action. By default, the container owner has this permission and can grant it to others.

parameters.name: ContainerName
parameters.description: The name of the container that the policy is assigned to.

nested_items.name: CorsPolicy
nested_items.description: The CORS policy assigned to the container.

nested_items.name: AllowedOrigins
nested_items.description: One or more response headers that you want users to be able to access from their applications (for example, from a JavaScript XMLHttpRequest object).

nested_items.name: AllowedMethods
nested_items.description: Identifies an HTTP method that the origin that is specified in the rule is allowed to execute.

nested_items.name: AllowedHeaders
nested_items.description: Specifies which headers are allowed in a preflight OPTIONS request through the Access-Control-Request-Headers header. Each header name that is specified in Access-Control-Request-Headers must have a corresponding entry in the rule. Only the headers that were requested are sent back.

nested_items.name: MaxAgeSeconds
nested_items.description: The time in seconds that your browser caches the preflight response for the specified resource.

nested_items.name: ExposeHeaders
nested_items.description: One or more headers in the response that you want users to be able to access from their applications (for example, from a JavaScript XMLHttpRequest object).
